Petitions.title: Federally Required Psychological Screenings for Police Employment and Federal Reforms
Petitions.summary: Introduce legislation requiring police officers to go through psychological screening every six months to one year.

Petitions.title: Justice for Breonna Taylor
Petitions.summary: File charges against Breonna Taylor's murderers, pay damages for her wrongful death to her family, appoint a special prosecutor to the case, enact federal legislation ending 'no-knock' warrants.

Petitions.title: Justice for David McAtee
Petitions.summary: Identify and arrest the LMPD murderer who killed David McAtee.

Petitions.title: Justice for Ahmaud Arbery: Pass Georgia Hate Crime Bill
Petitions.summary: Enact House Bill 426, placing enhanced penalties for hate crimes in the state of Georgia.

Petitions.title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
Petitions.summary: Reopen the case into Sandra Bland's death and the jail conditions that led to it.

Petitions.title: Commute Willie Simmons's Sentence
Petitions.summary: Demand for Alabama Governor Kay Ivey to commute the sentance of Willie Simmons, who has spent the last 38 years in prison for stealing $9.

Petitions.title: Justice for Alejandro Vargas Martinez
Petitions.summary: Raise awareness around the death of Alejandro Vargas Martinez, an innocent 15 year old who was shot 7 times, with no arrests yet made.

Petitions.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
Petitions.summary: Demand the state medical examiner to release the autopsy paperwork to Tete’s family and the public and hold the Portland Police Bureau accountable for failure to investigate Tete's death.

Petitions.title: Dismiss the charges on Marshae Jones and charge the one who shot her and her unborn baby
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Marshae Jones, who was shot while pregnant and charged with her unborn child's murder while the shooter walks free with no charges.

Petitions.title: Drop All Charges Against Incarcerated Trafficking Survivor Chrystul Kizer!
Petitions.summary: Dismiss charges against Chrystul Kizer, an incarcerated trafficking survivor who is being charged with life in prison for acting in self-defense against her trafficker.

Petitions.title: Julius Jones is innocent. Don't let him be executed by the state of Oklahoma.
Petitions.summary: Pressure the state of Oklahoma to not execute Julius Jones, who was convicted of murder at 19 in a trial featuring explicit racial bias.

Petitions.title: Reopen Kendrick Johnson's Case
Petitions.summary: Reopen the case of Kendrick Johnson, an honor-roll student-athlete who was killed by a jealous classmate whose F.B.I.-agent-father helped obfuscate evidence of his son's involvement in said murder.

Petitions.title: Justice For Emerald Black
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Emerald Black, a pregnant black woman, who upon being pulled over by police, was thrown to the ground by one officer while another stomped on her stomach, killing her unborn child.

Petitions.title: Justice for Dion Johnson
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Dion Johnson, who was shot and killed by police while unarmed and sleeping in his car.

Petitions.title: Justice for Amir Worship
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Amir Worship, a 12 year old who was shot by police while sitting in his bed at home, after just having woken up

Petitions.title: Justice for Desmond Franklin
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Desmond Franklin, a father of four, who was shot and killed by an off-duty police officer while stopped at a red light. The cop who shot him remains uncharged and is on paid leave.

Petitions.title: Justice for the death of Joel Acevedo by off duty MPD Officer Michael Mattioli
Petitions.summary: Demand the immediate firing and arrest of the police officer who choked Joel Acevedo to death after inviting him to his house for a get-together.

Petitions.title: Charge the Hennepin County Medical Examiner for minimizing George Floyd's C.O.D.
Petitions.summary: Bring charges against the medical examiner who attempted to falsely misattribute George Floyd's death to heart disease, making it easier for Floyd's murderers to get off uncharged.

Petitions.title: Justice For Joāo Pedro
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Joāo Pedro, who was killed in his home by Rio de Janeiro police. In 2019 alone, Rio police killed 1,814 people; an all time record.

Petitions.title: Justice for Matthew Tucker
Petitions.summary: Demand the firing of Michael Hamilton of the Riverside County Police Department, shot and killed Matthew Tucker after he called police because he was having suicidal thoughts.

Petitions.title: Abolish Prison Labour in the USA
Petitions.summary: Under the 13th Amendment, slavery was abolished, except for those convicted of a crime. Now, prisoners in the US are used for labor by private corporations, while getting paid between 12 and 40 cents an hour.

Petitions.title: Petition to Governor Brian Kemp to remove Rockdale County Sheriff Eric J. Levett
Petitions.summary: Demand the removal of Rockdale County Sheriff Eric J. Levett who oversaw the blatant human rights violations leaidng to the death of Shali Tilson.

Petitions.title: Justice for Elijah McClain
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Elijah McClain who was killed by police while walking home after going to the convenience store to buy tea.

Petitions.title: Children don't belong in cages
Petitions.summary: End long-term, indefinite detention of immigrant children

Petitions.title: Demand Justice for Darren Rainey
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Darren Rainey, who was killed by prison guards while in jail for a non-violent offense by being locked in an intentionally scalding hot shower for two hours.

Petitions.title: Justice for Amiya Braxton
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Amiya Braxton, a 7 year old who was killed in her own driveway, after stepping off the school bus, by a driver who swerved off the road and onto her property.

Petitions.title: Ban the use of inhumane rubber bullets
Petitions.summary: Ban the use of rubber bullets, an incredibly damaging and potentially lethal form of weaponry being used by police against peaceful protesters.

Petitions.title: Make racially motivated crime an act of terror and declare hate groups terrorist
Petitions.summary: A proposal to consider enacting legislation that labels hate crimes as acts of terror, declares hate groups as domestic terrorist organizations and requires law enforcement officers who kill civilians in the line of duty to be immediately taken into custody.

Petitions.title: Justice For Amari Boone
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Amari Boone, a three year old who was killed as a result of child abuse. No charges have been made.

Petitions.title: Justice for Tamir Rice
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for Tamir Rice, who was killed by police at 12 years old.

Petitions.title: STOP ICE FROM POISONING IMMIGRANTS!
Petitions.summary: ICE has been spraying immigrants with HDQ NEUTRAL 100 times a day, a germicidal detergent that causes skin irritation and serious eye damage.

Petitions.title: Fire Jared Yuen #4362
Petitions.summary: Fire Jared Yuen, the San Jose Police Officer who incited violence yelling "shut up bitch" and "let's go motherfucker" at peaceful protesters while fitted in police military gear.

Petitions.title: Justice for Big Floyd
Petitions.summary: Demand justice for George "Big" Floyd, who was murdered by police after his neck was kneeled on for 8 minutes and 46 seconds.

Petitions.title: Stop the war and end the famine in Yemen
Petitions.summary: Protest against the war in Yemen, where 2000 children monthly starve to death or die from preventable disease as a result of this needless conflict.

Petitions.title: Justice for Darrien Hunt - Reopen his case
Petitions.summary: Reopen the case into the killing of Darrien Hunt, who was murdered by police who claim to have felt threatened by the 22 year as he was cosplaying an anime character, carrying a fake plastic sword.

Petitions.title: Change KKK status into Terrorist Organization
Petitions.summary: Introduce legislation officially labeling the KKK a terrorist organization because that's what it is.

Petitions.title: 5 months is too long for no charges. Cameron Lamb's family deserves justice.
Petitions.summary: File charges against the police officers who murdered Cameron Lamb in his own driveway.

Petitions.title: PETITION TO TAKE DOWN ALL STATUES OF SLAVE TRADERS IN THE UK
Petitions.summary: Remove all statues of slave traders in the UK

Petitions.title: Reopen the investigation of LaVena Johnson's death
Petitions.summary: Demand the case of US Army Private LaVena Johnson's death to be reopened after it was ruled a suicide, despite pleniful evidence of rape and murder.

Petitions.title: Notes on Credibility
Petitions.summary: A statement from the African American Student Union (AASU) and AfricaGSD to the administration of the Harvard Graduate School of Design

Petitions.title: Open Letter to the YSoA in Support of BLM
Petitions.summary: The YSoA must commit to engage its community and allocate its resources to affect systemic change with humility, transparency, and specificity. The following demands represent the collective voice of more than one hundred YSoA Alumni who met on Sunday, June 7th, and the many alumni who have co-signed, to reckon with our past and envision a progressive future for the school

Petitions.title: UVA Students, Alums, Faculty: A-School Call to Action
Petitions.summary: As you may have seen, last week Dean Ila Berman released a Message to the Community in regards to the killing of George Floyd. In response to this Message, a group of A-School students and alumni wrote a letter expressing a vital Call for Action.

Petitions.title: A Letter to the University of Toronto’s John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design (DFALD)
Petitions.summary: On Dismantling Systemic Anti-Black Racism

Petitions.title: Sign the NOMAS@VT Statement On Racism
Petitions.summary: A condemnation of any and every form of racism that lives within the College of Architecture and Urban Studies at Virginia Tech and a set of demands to the college

Petitions.title: Rice School of Architecture Call to Action Co-Signees
Petitions.summary: Commentary on the current state of the Rice School of Architectre as well as a list of changes to be met

Petitions.title: Stuart Weitzman School of Design Letter Co-Signees
Petitions.summary: “We call upon the administrative leadership of the School of Design to pursue immediate action across all departments towards dismantling the destructive biases and inequity which persists within our institution. We have outlined an initial fourteen recommendations for immediate action”

Petitions.title: Design Justice Actions for Taubman College
Petitions.summary: A statement from the students, student organizations, and alumni of University of Michigan Taubman College to Taubman Leadership and Faculty...

Petitions.title: Design Justice for Black Lives Demands
Petitions.summary: Our obligation to each other, to the built environment, and in solidarity with black lives is to hold all complicit actors in these systems accountable, including organizations, schools, industry leaders, and legislative bodies. Design professions are as complicit as any. In accordance with our values and in defense of black lives, we demand the following...

Petitions.title: Prevent deaths in custody caused by improper restraint.
Petitions.summary: The events in the United States and the death of George Floyd, highlight the endemic issue of deaths in custody as a result of improper restraint. This issue is not confined to the United States. In Australia, this issue disproportionately affects Indigenous people: on average, an Aboriginal Australian dies in custody every month.
Petitions.taken_from: AUS/US DONATIONS AND ANTI- RACISM RESOURCES

Petitions.title: Justice for George Floyd
Petitions.summary: George Floyd was murdered by a Minneapolis police officer. Demand justice.

Petitions.title: Justice for George Floyd, Another Black Man Needlessly Murdered by Police
Petitions.summary: George Floyd was murdered by a Minneapolis police officer. Demand justice.

Petitions.title: Demand justice for George Floyd
Petitions.summary: “I can’t breathe,” were the words George Floyd uttered with his hands handcuffed behind his back, while a police officer kneeled directly on his neck, refusing to move for more than seven minutes.

Petitions.title: #JusticeforFloyd: Demand the officers who killed George Floyd are charged with murder.
Petitions.summary: It happened again. His name was George Floyd, and on May 25th he was murdered by Minneapolis police officers.

Petitions.title: The Minneapolis Police Officers to be charged for murder after killing innocent black man
Petitions.summary: Monday May 25. 2020 Minneapolis PD murdered an African American man who was unarmed and not dangerous.

Petitions.title: #JusticeforBre: Police officers who killed Breonna Taylor must be FIRED
Petitions.summary: The FBI has announced an investigation into the murder of Breonna Taylor. We're still demanding Louisville Mayor Greg Fischer fire the officers now! Sign the petition and dial the mayor at 844-298-2731 to demand #JusticeforBre.

Petitions.title: #JusticeForBre
Petitions.summary: Neither the Louisville Metro Police nor Mayor Greg Fischer have given her mother any answers. "Not one person has talked to me. Not one person has explained anything to me," Tamika Palmer, Taylor’s mother, said in an interview. "I want justice for her. I want them to say her name. There’s no reason Breonna should be dead at all."

Petitions.title: Justice for Breonna Taylor, Another Innocent Black Woman Murdered by Police in Her Own Home
Petitions.summary: Two months before the murder of George Floyd by police officers in Minneapolis, Minnesota, an innocent Black woman was murdered in her own home in the middle of the night by plain-clothed police officers in Louisville, Kentucky.

Petitions.title: Disbarment of George E. Barnhill
Petitions.summary: We are calling for the disbarment of prosecutor George E. Barnhill. We feel his decision to sit on the case of Ahmaud Arbery's murder for three months was out of prejudice/racism and a personal relationship with the murderers.

Petitions.title: Justice For Ahmuad Arbery
Petitions.summary: Ahmuad was taking his morning jog in his neighborhood in Georgia and came a cross a white father and son who shot and killed him for taking a jog. There is video footage of this cold blooded murder but, the father and son who murdered an innocent man are walking free because one of them used to be a cop.

Petitions.title: JUSTICE FOR REGIS KORCHINSKI-PAQUET
Petitions.summary: Regis Korchinski-Paquet was murdered by Toronto Police. A call was made for a domestic incident and Toronto police officers were present on the 24th floor in a High Park apartment building to "observe" 29-year old, Regis. Shortly after, she allegedly fell off the balcony.

Petitions.title: Justice For Tony McDade
Petitions.summary: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. As of right now I haven’t seen many people talking about this, but I would really like to get his name out there.

Petitions.title: Demand Justice for Tony McDade
Petitions.summary: On May 27th, 2020, Tony McDade, a black transgender masculine person was shot five times in the back and killed by a Tallahassee Police Department (TPD) officer.

Petitions.title: Demand Florida lawmakers stop shielding the cop who killed trans Black man, Tony McDade! Reveal his identity NOW!
Petitions.summary: Despite accounting for just one-tenth of a percent of the population, at least 38 Black trans people were murdered in the U.S. in 2019 and the first five months of 2020 — and more often than not, there is no accountability for the killer. No justice. That is certainly the case in Tallahassee where Tony McDade, a Black transgender man who was suspected in a recent stabbing, was shot to death by police on May 27.

Petitions.title: Justice for Belly Mujinga.
Petitions.summary: This petition exists to help find and prosecute the individual who assaulted Belly Mujinga at London Victoria whilst knowingly being infected with COVID-19. This cruel and senseless act of unprovoked violence ultimately likely lead to her death at the hands of this relentless virus and the hospitalisation of her colleague.

Petitions.title: CORRECTING A WRONGFUL CONVICTION. Kyjuanzi Harris
Petitions.summary: In 2011, Mr.Harris was arrested without cause and held against his will for two years in the county jail. In December of 2013 he went to court for 3 days were a jury came back with a a guilty verdict. Convicting him of life in prison without parole.  He’s been in prison for 9 years. What you need to know.

Petitions.title: Refus de la loi visant à empêcher la diffusion des images de violences policières
Petitions.summary: Censorship Of Police Brutality In France

Petitions.title: Justice for Sean
Petitions.summary: This is Sean. He was a victim of police brutality that happened May 6th, 2020. He was running from the police and was on Facebook live. The police officer tased him while he was going down and then shot the man 14 times in the back.

Petitions.title: Justice for Sean Reed!
Petitions.summary: Yesterday, excessive use of violence ended the life of a unarmed man by the name of Sean Reed.

Petitions.title: Justice For Tamir Rice
Petitions.summary: More than a year after police shot and killed my 12-year-old cousin Tamir Rice as he played in a park with a toy gun, a grand jury declined to charge the officers who opened fire on Tamir in less than 2 seconds of arriving to the scene...

Petitions.title: Fire Racist Criminal Michael J Reynolds from the NYPD
Petitions.summary: An NYPD officer went to Nashville, TN, for a bachelor's party, and broke into his neighbors home by kicking in the door, then assaulted them while calling them racial slurs.

Petitions.title: #JusticeForJamee: Release the unedited Bodycam and Dashcam footage!
Petitions.summary: Release all unedited body cam footage from JSO Officer Josue Garriga and other officers involved including dash cam footage the evening of December 14th, 2019 when Jamee was killed by Officer Garriga.

Petitions.title: Justice For Darrius Stewart
Petitions.summary: 19 year old Darrius Stewart lost his life in 2015 by a police officer In Memphis in a case of mistaken identity. He was completely unarmed.

Petitions.title: We want justice for 19 year old Darrius Stewart gunned down by a police officer on May 23, 2015
Petitions.summary: We need everybody's help and support to focus on what happened here in Memphis to Darrius Stewart, an unarmed 19-year-old, who was gunned down by a white cop in a case of mistaken identity. We are looking for justice for the victim in this case.

Petitions.title: FREE SIYANDA
Petitions.summary: How would you feel if your loved one was racially abused and beaten by a group of people?  Then instead of being protected by the justice system, was sentenced to 4 ½ years for defending themselves. This is what has happened to Siyanda Mngaza.

Petitions.title: Wis. Teen Face Life in Prison for Killing Man Who Allegedly Raped Her and Sold Her for Sex
Petitions.summary: A Wisconsin teenager is facing life in prison after admitting to killing an accused pedophile who allegedly abused her and sold her to other men for sex.

Petitions.title: Justice for Andile Mchunu (Bobo)
Petitions.summary: Andile Mchunu (Bobo) was beaten by a group of men for allegedly stealing alcohol and money. His sister came to fetch him after it was reported that he was being beaten but she was told to go fetch him some clothes and when she came back from fetching the clothes she was told that Andile has escaped. Which is hard to believe because a video of him unconscious has been circulating and a person in his state would’ve never been able to escape. And now the boy is nowhere to be found. As a community of Hambanathi we need justice to be served for Andile Mchunu (Bobo)

Petitions.title: Exonerate Eric Riddick
Petitions.summary: We are three undergraduate students at Georgetown University working with Georgetown's Prisons and Justice Initiative and the Igwe Firm on this case. We are also working alongside Eric's family and legal team with the goal of exonerating him after he has served over 27 years for a crime that he did not commit.

Petitions.title: Justice For Zinedine
Petitions.summary: Zinedine Karabo Gioia deserves justice. On her 21st birthday, July 21st 2018, she was date raped by BRENDAN RUNDLE in Gaborone, Botswana. Nothing was done.

Petitions.title: Demand a retrial for Angel Bumpass wrongfully convicted 13 year old with a life sentence
Petitions.summary: 13 YEAR OLD FEMALE FALSELY CONVICTED OF MURDER

Petitions.title: We Demand Justice for Sheku Bayoh, We Demand to Know the TRUTH.
Petitions.summary: My cousin Sheku Bayoh was detained in police custody in Kircaldy, near Edinburgh, Scotland on Sunday 3 May. He did not leave police custody alive.

Texts.title: Justice for George Floyd
Texts.summary: Officer J Alexander Keung was set for bail and quickly released. There should not be bail for Murder. You can use the resources below to demand every cop involved be charged without bail.

Texts.title: Justice for George Floyd
Texts.summary: Get in contact with the District Attorney and Minneapolis Mayor. Leave a message for them DEMANDING that 4 officers including Derek Chauvin (Badge #1087) and Tou Thao (Badge #7162) be arrested for the Murder of George Floyd.

Texts.title: Justice for Breonna Taylor
Texts.summary: Breonna Taylor was murdered in her house by police who raided the wrong house and was shot 8 times while she was sleeping.

More than One Click.title: Design As Protest
More than One Click.summary: If you are interested in further engagement and support of DAP Actions, please review the Action Campaigns below and sign up to join our calls and begin supporting the rollout of that Action. Expected commitment is at least 1-2 (1hr) organizing calls per week and weekly independent work on your own schedule.

More than One Click.title: Architecture is Complicit
More than One Click.summary: First read the statement, if it resonates with you, click “Join Us” in the upper left-hand corner.

More than One Click.title: Where Are the Black Designers?
More than One Click.summary: Black designers: DM your poster asking, “Where are the Black designers?”,  to their Instagram; they will post every poster up until June 27th. Include the company you'd like them to @. Head over now to see instructions and examples.
